value.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

value.title: Create and implement application allowlists with adaptive application control
value.excerpt: You'll be able to implement Adaptive application controls within your organization to protect your Windows Server IaaS VMs.

value.title: Customize Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine images
value.excerpt: You'll be able to create new VMs from generalized images and use Azure Image Builder templates to create and manage images in Azure.

value.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to handle infrastructure and service failure, recover from the loss if data, and recover from a disaster by designing availability and recoverability into your architecture.

images.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
Design for availability and recoverability in Azure

value.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
value.excerpt: Scaling your system to handle load, identifying network bottlenecks, and optimizing your storage performance are important to ensure your users have the best experience. Learn how to make your application perform at its best.

images.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
Design for performance and scalability in Azure

value.title: Develop an App using the Maven Plugin for Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Use the Maven Plugin for Azure Functions to create a cloud-based function that is triggered when certain values are passed in the HTTP request, and outputs a log entry to track the activity.

value.title: Explore the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You learn about the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines (DSVM) and when to use each type.  You will learn about the Windows-based and Linux-based DSVMs which each support different needs.

images.title: Explore the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines

value.title: Discuss Azure fundamental concepts
value.excerpt: Learn about the different types and categories of cloud computing.

value.title: Implement hybrid backup and recovery with Windows Server IaaS
value.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Backup before learning to implement Recovery Vaults and Azure Backup Policies. You’ll learn to implement Windows IaaS VM recovery, perform backup and restore of on-premises workloads, and manage Azure VM backups.

value.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Implement hybrid network infrastructure
value.excerpt: You'll learn to connect your on-premises environment to Azure, implement subnets and routing between your on-premises and cloud environments, and ensure that workloads in the cloud and on-premises perform DNS resolution to locate each other.

value.title: Implement scale and high availability with Windows Server VM
value.excerpt: You'll learn how to implement scaling for virtual machine scale sets and load-balanced VMs. You'll also learn how to implement Azure Site Recovery.

value.title: Interactive deep learning with Jupyter, Docker and PyTorch on the Data Science Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: Learn to train deep learning models with Jupyter, PyTorch and the Data Science Virtual Machine.

images.title: Interactive deep learning with Jupyter, Docker and PyTorch on the Data Science Virtual Machine

value.title: Migrate an on-premises web application to Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Use the Azure App Service Migration Assistant to assess the readiness of a web app to be deployed on App Service, and perform the migration.

value.title: Migrate on-premises Windows Server instances to Azure IaaS virtual machines
value.excerpt: You'll be able to plan a migration and select appropriate server migration tools. You will also learn how to use Azure Migrate, how to assess physical servers, and how to migrate those servers.

value.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using the Maven Plugin for Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Use the Maven plugin for Azure App Service to develop a Java web app and deploy the app to Azure.

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for Eclipse
value.excerpt: Create a web app in Eclipse and deploy the app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for Eclipse.

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for IntelliJ
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to use Azure to host your Java web apps, built by using IntelliJ IDEA.

value.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
value.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

value.title: Understand Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine cost management
value.excerpt: You'll be able to use the Pricing calculator to assess likely costs, use Azure Advisor to monitor actual costs for Azure resources, implement Spot VMs and Azure Reservations, and describe benefits of Azure Hybrid licensing.

value.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
value.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: How to bulk edit app settings in App Service | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to configure the application settings and learn the basics of the Azure Portal.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal   And make sure to keep
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/J5itB7OrLrs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to configure a new virtual machine with the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: Microsoft Azure provides many virtual machine configuration options for any workload or application. In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about some of the configuration options that are available when setting up a virtual machine in the Azure Portal.   Try out these features in the
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/z5J5MQkbqvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to manage virtual machine connectivity with the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" series, learn how to easily manage virtual machine connectivity through the Azure Portal. You’ll learn how to manage virtual machine network security groups for virtual network subnets and virtual machines.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jCx4rxdWkTM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM Identity
value.excerpt: After completing this learning path, you’ll know how to implement identity in Azure. You’ll be able to extend an existing on-premises Active Directory identity service into Azure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS Active Directory domain controllers in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS active directory domain controllers in Azure

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM networking
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn about Azure IaaS networking and identity. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to implement IP addressing, manage DNS, and deploy and manage domain controllers in Azure.

topItems.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM IP addressing and routing
topItems.excerpt: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM IP addressing and routing

topItems.title: Implement DNS for Windows Server IaaS VMs
topItems.excerpt: Implement DNS for Windows Server IaaS VMs

topItems.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM network security
topItems.excerpt: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM network security

value.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).

value.title: Build a Web App with Refreshable Machine Learning Models
value.excerpt: Build a web app powered by machine learning models trained using Custom Vision AI service, and learn how to refresh them with GitHub Actions.

value.title: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS Active Directory domain controllers in Azure
value.excerpt: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS active directory domain controllers in Azure
